revised_title: The Trade-off Between Energetic Gain and Predation Risk in Animal Behavior
tldr: This article explores the trade-off between gaining energy and avoiding predation in animal behavior. The authors analyze various factors, such as time constraints, interruptions, refuges from predators, and stochasticity in food supply, to determine how an animal's decisions and state change over time. They provide general results and discuss how earlier models can be viewed as special cases of their findings.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior
